column1: Ras Mewrim was a headland on the coastline south-west of Eglarest
column2: in the land of the Falas in Beleriand.
column4: 190. The name only appears in the later additions to the The Second Silmarillion Map.

column3: was another name for the headland in the essay "Quendi and Eldar".
column4: pp. 378-379. The name was first typed Bar-in-Gwael
column5: but Tolkien later changed it to Bar-in-Mŷl and added the translation.

column1: The Sindarin name Bar-in-Mŷl consists of bar ("home") and mŷl ("gulls").
